column3: unknown3(string)
Waiting brings its own rewards.
Tastes change: now there is whisky.
Tread softly in someone's dreams.
There is elegance in the old ways.
Some charms are not for everyone.
There is an art in making everyone welcome.
Some men can drown in the deep pools of beautiful eyes.
Comfort comes in many forms.
A single look can say much.
There is much to be learned in the hearts of others.
Many hearts, set aflutter.
A ready wit saved many a fox.
Perfection never looks practiced.
Beauty waits behind a contract.
All the world, offered in an artful blush.
An enemy who waits to be killed should be hunted.
An enemy who comes forward to be killed should be welcomed.
Not everything worth doing is worth doing openly.
No man fights if his belly is empty and his feet unshod.
Let the enemy pay for the war.
The man who does not know where the path leads goes only to his death.
Look to the defence of others.
Nothing can move the heart that has a noble purpose.
The right word will send thousands, willingly, to their deaths.
There is virtue in being first.
Speed is not the same as haste.
Boldness confuses the enemy if they expect caution.
The enemy's fear is a great ally.
The world turns, but there must be a still centre.
Faint hearts fear the dawn.
Measure twice, cut once.
Command without words.
Rice matters as much as bullets.
Legends cannot be destroyed.
Fire forges the sword; war, the soul.
“Cow after cow, pig after pig…”
Say little, and let fools think it was their own idea.
Keep the peace and win the people.
Who you know is always important.
The wind does not stop blowing, nor does the tree stop growing.
Loyalty can never be excessive.
Spread the word.
“Murder? No, no, no. Justice!”
Lead by example.
A word can be sharper than the sword.
Obedience is all: there is nothing else.
One idea, crystal clear, can change the world.
The right word can stop an army.
“Japan has a sacred mission, a destiny!”
Some things cannot be stopped.
Walk the left-hand path to reach the people.
“…only if you get caught.”
Soldiers talk too readily about their glories.
The smallest thing out of place is wrong.
Only the strong will survive.
Silence is eloquent testimony to deeds in the shadows.
Elegance in all things, even death.
Death does not wait patiently for some men.
Hide in plain sight.
There is a new fashion for spanners.
Reach out and take something.
The gift is a blessing to the giver.
Be somewhere else.
It was the squid.
There are many ways to deceive the enemy.
Pass within through the shadowed door.
Even the killer may have compassion in his heart.
Reputation is only what others say of your deeds.
“Things will be as I say.”
The guilty will be found out.
The way of the warrior is the resolute acceptance of death.
Spiders will always eat flies.
Fear does much that words cannot.
Fools hear what they want to hear.
In every man there is a need for discipline.
The road to hell is paved with ignorant souls.
“Compromise? A disease of foreigners!”
Passion, properly harnessed, is a strength.
The man who rules his own heart rules others.
Pay now, pay again later.
Simple people need simple guidance.
“No. I am not.”
“From the Shogun's mouth, to your ear.”
“I’ve fired a bullet on every continent. Hit someone too.”
“Home? A barracks and a bottle, lad.”
An army goes nowhere without bullets, blankets and boots.
Know the lie of the land; see the truth.
There is much to learn, and little time.
“Your other left, damn your eyes!”
“Guns. Big guns. Really, really big guns. And chocolate.”
“He’s a dead man.”
“You do not frighten me, you kimonoed fop!”
“Artillery is the art of putting a shell up a mouse's arsehole. At 1000 yards.”
One bullet can change history.
The grave may slow some men, a little.
Fools, children and ignorant heathen savages fight fairly.
“Buy the rifles, before your rivals do.”
What's one more battle?
Intrigue lives in a make-up box.
Shame and pain: they both pierce the heart.
Grace in all things is most becoming.
A smile can hide many intentions.
A clever tongue has its uses.
The fox is cunning: she never reveals that she is a fox.
\More tea, dear?\""
There is an art in knowing who to know.
Men seldom dwell on danger; women are more prudent.
Wipe away the makeup and what remains?
Charm and deceit can ride the same dragon.
Knowing who to know always commands a price.
Flattery is all the better when it is sincere.
Education is too good to waste.
Tea is not to everyone's taste. Some prefer sake.
Hide behind a different smile.
Much can be learned from pillow talk.
Men rarely think when a smile promises everything.
All the world, offered in an artful blush.
Show the enemy what he wants to see.
To run is futile. To resist may be glorious!
Fear is a gelding knife.
The art of war requires an artist.
Make the tiger leave his forest.
The right word will send a man willingly to his death.
A general needs two brave words: \Follow me!\""
No man relishes fighting legends.
A master's shot cuts the breeze itself in two.
Once mounted, the vulgarity of battle slides away.
Some swords are lucky, and carried by heroes.
Honour is the robe of the warrior.
Fools fight fairly.
\Come now: you pay taxes ashore!\""
Thinking is dangerous.
Death does a man less credit than victory and honour.
The first always have the greater share of glory.
In the midst of battle a man makes his own fate.
\A gift, no more, no less.\""
What game awaits the hunter in the shadows?
Discover what a man wants: use it against him.
Two eyes, two ears, one mouth.
Three flies: cloven in twain.
Law is both a club and a dagger.
\Your merchandise... Delicate, is it?\""
Lesser men are easily swayed.
\So, you really want to disappear?\""
A man set on his course can do anything.
\You have the right to bleed copiously…\""
Move the people, and shake the world.
Wisdom is forged in the hearth of a calm soul.
Words have power when spoken with faith.
An idea is a ripple on the pool of a quiet mind.
Warriors and merchants: speak to each in their own tongues.
Walk the path of peace to avoid enemies.
Speak to each man in words that pierce his soul.
Walk the path and find yourself.
Authorities can be found to back any argument.
Retire from the world, but do not forget it.
A point must be made, and a message delivered.
Villainy has its uses.
Any idiot can run away.
Death comes in many unusual, sharp and pointy forms.
Confusion is useful, even when it smells like an oni's fart.
A plausible man has the keys to every gate.
\Why do you think I am behind you?\""
Wise truth wears a liar's kimono from time to time.
Soldiers talk soldiers' talk.
Wear the shadows like a cloak.
The people do not need to know they have been bought.
\I am honest in this much: I enjoy it.\""
A momentary bitterness solves many problems.
Buildings fall down better with a little help.
Command at sea requires special generalship.
There is nothing dishonourable in surprise.
There is an art to leading peasants.
Glory is not enough: there must be steel behind it.
The man who does not flinch has won in his soul.
Battle is a calculation, a reading of the future.
Any blow can be turned aside, or avoided.
Honour is the bond of the samurai.
Infantry win battles, under the right commander.
What man will not follow courage?
Fear can be sharper than steel in an enemy heart.
Some warriors become dragons rather than slay them.
Some men need only \be\", they are beyond \"do\"."
The warrior and his mount are one.
The sword is the soul of the samurai.
Mastery of the cruel sea requires cruelty in turn.
The word cuts as surely as the blade.
Faith armours the heart, and clears the head.
No wall can withstand the fury of men.
A wall is as strong as the hearts behind it.
Contemplation and Go bring military wisdom.
To command others, a man must master himself.
When a man listens to his heart, all else follows.
He who stands apart from the world will never change the world.
Gold always eases the slight stings of pride.
“No one needs to see that!”
A hunter's eye and a jilted lover's suspicions bring only sadness.
“Many eyes, many tongues: one understanding.”
The quickness of the hand deceives the eye.
Lies and truth are leaves floating on the water.
\Get your kimono on, you're nicked!\""
\I am the law!\""
For all their prattle, merchants have ears and hear much.
\How much porcelain gets broken at the end of the day?\""
The man who will do anything for his lord has iron in his soul.
Duty is fleet footed.
There is secret honour in dishonour for a lord's cause.
“There is no spirit of injustice!”
All sins can be washed away by the blood of the Lamb.
Study of scripture leads to the correct path in every life.
The Church is the Faith, and must be defended and strengthened.
\The fires and torments of Hell await thee, heathen beasts!\""
There are more roads to God than there are to Rome.
A man needs two waraji: faith and reason.
Walk the earth to find the light.
Grievous sin lies in not educating sinners.
Persuasion in the service of the Lord has no limits.
There is only the Word, and his Holiness. All else is falsehood.
Doing God's work, and the work of the Church, cleanses all sins.
He who stands apart from the world will never change the world.
“There is no spirit of injustice!”
\I understand the questions, and dimly see what might be answers.\""
A man needs two waraji: faith and reason.
\I seek not to know the answers, but to understand the questions.\""
The faithless must be taught harsh lessons, so that they learn.
War is cruelty: why must spirits weep?
When a man listens to his heart, all else follows.
Walk the earth to find the light.
Faith and reason are the daisho of wisdom.
Learn from the wisdom of others to understand your own lack of wisdom.
A single grain of rice holds all the truths of the world.
He who stands apart from the world will never change the world.
A knife is truly dangerous only in the right hands.
In the service of the great, a man must choose strange friends.
The oppressed are always grateful to their saviour.
Lies made flesh are not falsehood.
There is always a way out. Always.
Anything is a weapon, a weapon anything.
Fire, sulphur and demon's breath are tools for the cunning.
Leave no footprints, even in darkness.
To hide is one thing. To walk abroad another.
An army, for all its strength, can be a delicate thing.
Confusion is a powerful ally and friend.
A lifetime to master the art of stealth is time well spent.
Giving away another's riches is wisdom
Reputation is a weapon forged from your enemy's fears.
Death comes in many forms, not all of them edged.
There is beauty in destruction, and in flames.
In silence much may be learned.
